interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Heaven's Lost Property - The Angeloid of Clockwork (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)
Review Date: 2014/09/20
Store: Brittany Karbowski  (Actor),     Greg Ayres  (Actor),     Christopher Bevins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'BR/DVD.', 'Amazon.com', 'Although the', "Heaven's Lost Property", 'feature', 'The Angeloid of Clockwork', "(2011) was released theatrically, it plays like a choppy series of OVA adventures cut together. Pretty high school student Hiyori Kazane nurtures a crush on Tomoki. She watches him with his friend Sohara and the Angeloids, but she's too shy to say anything to him. The first half of the movie echoes the original series: Tomoki and his friends go about their usual misadventures around town and at local festivals. The filmmakers include plenty of jiggle shots and underwear jokes. At one point, the girls' panties fly away like a swarm of butterflies, although the viewer never learns why. The last third of the film turns serious: apparently Hiyori is dreaming her everyday adventures while her body lies in the facility known as Synapse. When she's hit by a truck, Hiyori dies in her dream and reenters her real body. She wants to come back to Sorami so intensely, she returns as an Angeloid--to destroy Tomoki. The tragic romance plays oddly against the gross jokes. During much of the film, Tomoki is drawn as a sort of toy-avatar who argues with himself on the toilet and rides the conveyor belt in a sushi bar, naked on a plastic tray. Although", "Heaven's Lost Property", 'has proved popular on both sides of the Pacific,', 'otaku', "who watch it for the fan service shots probably won't enjoy the ill-starred romance, and romantics will be put off by the raw jokes. (Rated TV MA: risqué humor, toilet humor, nudity, cartoon violence, violence against women)", '--Charles Solomon']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Contributor': 'Brittany Karbowski, Jamie Marchi, Christopher Bevins, Eric Vale, Greg Ayres', 'Language': 'Japanese, English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Item model number': '704400058837', 'Director': 'Christopher Bevins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 26, 2013', 'Actors': 'Brittany Karbowski, Greg Ayres, Eric Vale, Jamie Marchi', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Funimation Prod', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This is probably the most funny and cutest anime me and my hubs have ever seen. It's packed with pervy stuff, cuteness, and humor. This anime will strike the heartstrings and make your sides hurt from laughing too hard. It's perfectly scripted and made- it's just too much perfection in one show. Daisuki!
Review Title: Sora no Otoshimono/Heaven's Lost Property...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime
['Product Description', 'BR/DVD.', 'Amazon.com', 'Although the', "Heaven's Lost Property", 'feature', 'The Angeloid of Clockwork', "(2011) was released theatrically, it plays like a choppy series of OVA adventures cut together. Pretty high school student Hiyori Kazane nurtures a crush on Tomoki. She watches him with his friend Sohara and the Angeloids, but she's too shy to say anything to him. The first half of the movie echoes the original series: Tomoki and his friends go about their usual misadventures around town and at local festivals. The filmmakers include plenty of jiggle shots and underwear jokes. At one point, the girls' panties fly away like a swarm of butterflies, although the viewer never learns why. The last third of the film turns serious: apparently Hiyori is dreaming her everyday adventures while her body lies in the facility known as Synapse. When she's hit by a truck, Hiyori dies in her dream and reenters her real body. She wants to come back to Sorami so intensely, she returns as an Angeloid--to destroy Tomoki. The tragic romance plays oddly against the gross jokes. During much of the film, Tomoki is drawn as a sort of toy-avatar who argues with himself on the toilet and rides the conveyor belt in a sushi bar, naked on a plastic tray. Although", "Heaven's Lost Property", 'has proved popular on both sides of the Pacific,', 'otaku', "who watch it for the fan service shots probably won't enjoy the ill-starred romance, and romantics will be put off by the raw jokes. (Rated TV MA: risqué humor, toilet humor, nudity, cartoon violence, violence against women)", '--Charles Solomon']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** Predominantly enjoys anime, particularly titles that blend humor, romance, and fanservice elements. 
- **Content Style:** Prefers works that are lighthearted and comedic, often featuring quirky characters and humorous situations mixed with emotional undertones. 
- **Quality Appreciation:** Values well-crafted storytelling, script quality, and well-animated visuals. Rated the product highly for its combination of entertainment and execution.
- **Experience Seeking:** Looks for experiences that evoke strong emotional responses, both laughter and heartfelt moments, indicating a preference for comedic yet thoughtful narratives.
- **Social Viewing:** Engages in shared viewing experiences, indicating that content is enjoyed with a partner, enhancing the enjoyment of titles that have humorous and romantic elements.
- **Product Format:** Shows a preference for high-quality media formats, specifically Blu-ray, demonstrating an interest in the best available viewing experience for anime content.

Overall, this user gravitates towards engaging anime that successfully merges comedy and romance, particularly those marked by humor that may include risqué themes. They appreciate quality production and enjoy sharing their viewing experiences with others.
